featured.text: By this time the cook was angry and decided to do exactly what the dinner guest wanted: slice the potatoes as thin as possible.
At approximately the same time, the Earl of Sandwich popularized a new way of eating bread—in thin slices, with something (e.g., jam or cucumbers) between them.
The cook sliced some potatoes thinner than before and prepared them for the complaining guest.
“He would deliberate before eating even a slice of pizza because it has 350 calories,” the mother said.

definition.zh_def: 切片，指將物體或食物分割成薄片的動作或結果。
definition.en_def: To cut something into thin pieces.
definition.example: She decided to slice the bread for the sandwiches.
